sentence.Network_en: The composer was one of many illustrious visitors to the town.
sentence.Network_cn: 那位作曲家是许多造访过这个城市的杰出人物之一。

sentence.Network_en: He enjoyed a long and illustrious career as a radio producer.
sentence.Network_cn: 他作为电台节目制作人的生涯漫长而辉煌.

sentence.Network_en: As Faldo's final putt rattled in, he qualified to join a select band of illustrious sportsmen.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着福尔多的最后一杆轻击，球应声入洞，他得以跻身门槛颇高的顶级运动员之列。

...真鲂（学名：Eumegistus illustris）为乌鲂科真鲂属的鱼类。分布于日本、新几内亚和挪威以及中国东海等海域。该物种的模式产地在檀香山。== 参考文献 ==reflist== 扩展阅读 ==refbeg.
...真乌鲂（学名：Eumegistus illustris），又名深海三角仔、黑飞刀、黑皮刀，为乌鲂科真乌鲂属下的一个种。== 参考文献 ==refbegin* TaiBNET| zh=真乌鲂 | id=381458 | binomial=Eumegistus i.
“赫”字用潮州话... ... 赫赫[ impressive;majestic;illustrious] 赫赫有名[ illustrious celebrated;far-famed] 赫然耸现[ loom].

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin illustris 'clear, bright' + -ous

entry.def: If you describe someone as an illustrious person, you mean that they are extremely well known because they have a high position in society or they have done something impressive.

example.ex: ...the most illustrious scientists of the century.
example.tran: 本世纪最杰出的科学家们
他漫长辉煌的职业生涯
